albisccp.comment: ISCCP Mean Cloud Albedo. Time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction {:cltisccp} - see  http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html

aod550volso4.comment: Aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to stratospheric volcanic aerosols
aod550volso4.long_name: Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm Due to Stratospheric Volcanic Aerosols

ccb.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
ccb.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base

ccldncl.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.
ccldncl.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Convective Cloud Tops

cct.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
cct.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top

clcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in CALIPSO standard atmospheric layers.

cldnci.comment: Concentration 'as seen from space' over ice-cloud portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with ice cloud or, if available, it is the sum over all ice cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total ice cloud top fraction (as seen from TOA) of each time sample when computing monthly mean.
cldnci.long_name: Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops

cldnvi.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

clhcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 220hPa
clhcalipso.long_name: CALIPSO High Level Cloud Area Percentage

clisccp.comment: Percentage cloud cover in optical depth categories.

clivi.comment: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clivic.comment: calculate mass of convective ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

cllcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 840hPa
cllcalipso.long_name: CALIPSO Low Level Cloud Cover Percentage

clmcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 560hPa
clmcalipso.long_name: CALIPSO Mid Level Cloud Cover Percentage

clt.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

cltcalipso.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the  Cloud-Aerosol Lidar and Infrared Pathfinder Satellite Observation (CALIPSO) instrument. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

cltisccp.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the International Satellite Cloud Climatology Project (ISCCP) analysis. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  (MODIS). Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

clwvi.comment: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clwvic.comment: calculate mass of convective condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

hfdsl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
hfdsl.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Downward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed downward (negative upward). The vertical heat flux in air is the sum of all heat fluxes i.e. radiative, latent and sensible. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.
hfdsl.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Land Surface

hfdsnb.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
hfdsnb.comment: Heat flux from snow into the ice or land under the snow.
hfdsnb.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Snow Base

hfls.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

hfmlt.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
hfmlt.comment: Energy consumed or released during liquid/solid phase changes.

hfrs.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
hfrs.comment: Heat transferred to a snow cover by rain..
hfrs.long_name: Heat Transferred to Snowpack by Rainfall

hfsbl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
hfsbl.comment: Energy consumed or released during vapor/solid phase changes.

hfss.comment: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

hur.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hurs.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hursmax.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hursmin.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hursminCrop.cell_methods: area: mean where crops time: minimum
hursminCrop.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
hursminCrop.long_name: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Relative Humidity over Crop Tile

hus19.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

hus8.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

hus850.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

jpdftaureicemodis.comment: Joint probability distribution function, giving probability of cloud as a function of optical thickness and particle size, as measured by MODIS. For cloud ice particles.
jpdftaureicemodis.long_name: MODIS Joint Distribution of Optical Thickness and Particle Size, Ice

jpdftaureliqmodis.comment: Joint probability distribution function, giving probability of cloud as a function of optical thickness and particle size, as measured by MODIS. For liquid cloud particles.
jpdftaureliqmodis.long_name: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid

loadbc.comment: The total dry mass of black carbon aerosol particles per unit area.

loaddust.comment: The total dry mass of dust aerosol particles per unit area.

loadnh4.comment: The total dry mass of ammonium aerosol particles per unit area.

loadno3.comment: The total dry mass of nitrate aerosol particles per unit area.

loadoa.comment: atmosphere dry organic content: This is the vertically integrated sum of atmosphere_primary_organic_content and atmosphere_secondary_organic_content (see next two table entries).
loadoa.long_name: Load of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter

loadpoa.comment: The total dry mass of primary particulate organic aerosol particles per unit area.
loadpoa.long_name: Load of Dry Aerosol Primary Organic Matter

loadso4.comment: The total dry mass of sulfate aerosol particles per unit area.

loadsoa.comment: The total dry mass of secondary particulate organic aerosol particles per unit area.
loadsoa.long_name: Load of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter

loadss.comment: The total dry mass of sea salt aerosol particles per unit area.

parasolRefl.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
parasolRefl.comment: Simulated reflectance from PARASOL as seen at the top of the atmosphere for 5 solar zenith angles. Valid only over ocean and for one viewing direction (viewing zenith angle of 30 degrees and relative azimuth angle 320 degrees).

pctisccp.comment: ISCCP Mean Cloud Top Pressure. Time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction {:cltisccp} - see  http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html

pr.comment: includes both liquid and solid phases

prCrop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where crops (comment: mask=cropFrac)
prCrop.comment: includes both liquid and solid phases

prc.comment: Convective precipitation at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

prhmax.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within hours time: maximum over hours
prhmax.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

prra.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
prra.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

prrc.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
prrc.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

prrsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
prrsn.comment: The fraction of the grid averaged rainfall which falls on the snow pack

prsn.comment: At surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

prsnc.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
prsnc.comment: convective precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase.

prsnsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
prsnsn.comment: The fraction of the snowfall which falls on the snow pack
prsnsn.long_name: Fraction of Snowfall (Including Hail and Graupel) on Snow

prw.comment: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

ps.comment: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

reffcclwtop.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius 'as seen from space' over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.
reffcclwtop.long_name: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Convective Cloud

reffsclwtop.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius 'as seen from space' over liquid stratiform cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.
reffsclwtop.long_name: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Stratiform Cloud

rlds.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean 'net downward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

rlus.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

rlut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

rlutcs.comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere

rsds.comment: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

rsdscs.comment: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

rsdscsdiff.comment: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations in clear sky conditions
rsdscsdiff.long_name: Surface Diffuse Downwelling Clear Sky Shortwave Radiation

rsdsdiff.comment: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations.

rsdt.comment: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere

rss.comment: Net downward shortwave radiation at the surface

rsus.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

rsut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

rsutcs.comment: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

sblnosn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
sblnosn.comment: Rate of sublimation of ice into the atmosphere from areas with no snow.
sblnosn.long_name: Sublimation of the Snow Free Area

scldncl.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over stratiform liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.
scldncl.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Stratiform Cloud Tops

sfcWindmax.comment: Daily maximum near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.

snmsl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
snmsl.comment: Mass flow rate of water draining out of the snow pack.

snrefr.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
snrefr.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Surface snow and ice refreezing flux' means the mass flux of surface  meltwater which refreezes within the snow or firn.
snrefr.long_name: Refreezing of Water in the Snow

snwc.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
snwc.comment: Total water mass of the snowpack (liquid or frozen), averaged over a grid cell and intercepted by the canopy.
snwc.long_name: Snow Water Equivalent Intercepted by the Vegetation

tasmax.comment: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: max')

tasmaxCrop.cell_methods: area: mean where crops time: maximum
tasmaxCrop.comment: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: max')
tasmaxCrop.long_name: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Air Temperature over Crop Tile

tasmin.comment: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: min')

tasminCrop.cell_methods: area: mean where crops time: minimum
tasminCrop.comment: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: min')
tasminCrop.long_name: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Air Temperature over Crop Tile

tau.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tau.comment: module of the momentum lost by the atmosphere to the surface.

tauu.comment: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface

tauupbl.comment: The  downward eastward stress associated with the models parameterization of the planetary boundary layer. (This request is related to a WGNE effort to understand how models parameterize the surface stresses.)
tauupbl.long_name: Eastward Surface Stress from Planetary Boundary Layer Scheme

tauv.comment: Downward northward wind stress at the surface

tauvpbl.comment: The  downward northward stress associated with the models parameterization of the planetary boundary layer. (This request is related to a WGNE effort to understand how models parameterize the surface stresses.)
tauvpbl.long_name: Northward Surface Stress from Planetary Boundary Layer Scheme

tdps.comment: Dew point temperature is the temperature at which a parcel of air reaches saturation upon being cooled at constant pressure and specific humidity.

tr.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tr.comment: Effective radiative surface temperature, averaged over the grid cell

ts.comment: Temperature of the lower boundary of the atmosphere

tsland.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tsland.comment: Temperature of the lower boundary of the atmosphere

tsns.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tsns.comment: Temperature of the snow surface as it interacts with the atmosphere, averaged over a grid cell.

ua19.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

ua8.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

uas.comment: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind

va19.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

va8.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

vas.comment: Northward component of the near surface wind

wap19.comment: Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards)

wap500.comment: Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards) at 500hPa level;

wap8.comment: Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards)

zg1000.comment: Geopotential height on the 1000 hPa surface

zg19.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

zg8.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

zmla.comment: The atmosphere boundary layer thickness is the 'depth' or 'height' of the (atmosphere) planetary boundary layer.
